content.description:
Standard start (Parallel cracks behind a tree - 5.7) to the ledge, then move right and up to a pedestal, (same as Flight deck)

Then climb back left into a thin, flared crack.

climbs.name: Sleep Walker
climbs.fa: Scott Woodruff, Brad Gilbert, Dan Hare, 1978.

content.description:
Use the standard start (parallel cracks behind a tree - 5.7) to the ledge, then continue straight up the crack system, through a small roof, and continuing to the lower, central tree on the face.

VAR. - Somnambulist - at the roof, climb right into a right-facing, right-leaning corner and then hand traverse back left when you reach the second roof.

Use the standard start: (parallel cracks behind a tree - 5.7) to access the ledge.

Traverse left on the ledge and climb to a pair of fixed pins, then generally straight up to the high tree on the left and the top.
content.location: Central, tallest part of the face.

content.description:
A difficult, slabby crux right off the ground sets you at the obvious horizontal, and continue through knobby easier climbing to the ledge (P1).  Traverse left over the anchors on Dari Design and up the arete to the summit (P2,3), 5.8.

Or, go straight up from the top of pitch one ledge Into Temptation, 5.9+.
content.location: Left arete of the cliff, right of Boulder Falls.

content.description:
Standard access (parallel cracks behind a tree - 5.7) to the ledge then move up right to the pedestal (same as Vertical Stall).

Continue up and right.  Where the crack fades, climb an arete past a bolt.

climbs.name: Dary Design
climbs.fa: Paul Glover, a million years ago

content.description:
Do the same start as

Hubris

. Climb through the arched roof to the two bolt anchor.
content.protection: Some manky bolts and fixed pins.
content.location: It is the first route right of Boulder Falls.
